_meanings:
[{#asti, AsIt, astu#},
{#syAt#}; defective in non-conjugational
tenses, its forms being made up from
the root {#BU#}].

{@--10@} To take
place, happen.

{@--11@} To be in a 
particular relation, to be affected (with
<ab>loc.</ab>); {#kiMnu Kalu yaTA#} 
{#vayamasyAmevamiyamapyasmAt prati syAt#} <ls>Ś. 1.</ls> {#astu#} well, let
it be; {#evamastu, taTAstu#} so be it, amen.
The form {#Asa#} joined to roots in
forming their periphrastic perfect
is sometimes separated from the
root and used by itself; {#taM pAtayAM#}
{#praTamamAsa papAta paScAt#} <ls>R. 9. 61</ls>, <ls n="R.">16. 86.</ls>
[Cf. <ab>L.</ab> {%est%} and <ab>Gr.</ab> {%esti%} with
{#asti#}; {%esse%}; Zend. {%āsti%}; Pers. {%hast%},
{%ast%}]. --WITH {#ati#} to be over, excel,
surpass.
to be at hand, reach.

(with <ab>loc.</ab> or an <ab>adv.</ab> of place)
{1} to be in anything. {2} to belong
to, be closely connected with.

{1} to belong to, to fall to
one's share; {#yanmamABizyAt#} <ls>Sk.</ls> {2}
to be over. {3} to excel, surpass. {4} to 

domineer or to tyrannize over, rule
over.

to be near to
or in.

{1} to be in the way. {2} to
surpass. {3} to pass or spend (time).
{4} to pervade.

{1} to be in front
of. {2} to be in an extraordinary
degree, to preponderate, excel, 
surpass.

{1} to be equal to, be a
match for. {2} to rival, emulate, vie
with. {3} to be a representative of,
stand in place of.

(<ab>Atm.</ab> {#vyatihe#}, 
{#vyatise; vyatiste#}) to excel, surpass, be
above or superior to, out-weigh;
{#anyo vyatiste tu mamApi DarmaH#} <ls>Bk. 2. 35.</ls>

{@--2@} To drive away, 
remove.
{@--3@} To frighten or scare away.

{@--4@} To throw or take away, let go,
leave, give up; as in {#astamAna#}, 
{#astaSoka, astakopa#}; see {#asta#}. --WITH {#ati#}
to shoot beyond or at, overpower
(with arrows); {#atyasta#} having shot
beyond, having surpassed or 
excelled; joined in <ab>acc.</ab> <ab>Tat.</ab> <ab>comp.</ab>;  
<ls>P. II. 1. 24</ls>.

to throw over or 
upon, hurl at.
to stretch.
{@--2@} To take or receive, seize.

{@--3@}
To shine (The examples usually 
cited to illustrate this sense are  
{#nizpraBaSca praBurAsa BUBftAM#} <ls>R. 11. 81</ls>; {#tenAsa lokaH#}
{#pitfmAn vinetrA#} <ls n="R.">14. 23</ls>; {#lAvaRya utpAdya#}
{#ivAsa yatnaH#} <ls>Ku. 1. 35.</ls> But the sense
of {#didIpe#} or ‘shone’ is far-fetched,
though Vāmana is disposed to take
it. It seems preferable to regard {#Asa#}
in these instances as equivalent to
{#baBUva#}, either taking it, as Śākaṭāyana
does, as an indeclinable  
{#tiNaMtapratirUpakamavyayaM#}, or considering it, as Vallabha
does, as an ungrammatical form used
against the rules of grammar,  
{#prAmAdikaH prayogaH#}; see <ls>Malli.</ls> on <ls>Ku. 1. 35</ls>).
